title: REVIEW --- Play: News Quiz
text:
B. Securities and Exchange Commission

C. Commodity Futures Trading Commission

D. Tennessee Valley Authority

---

2. The World Series started. Where's the factory that makes the hundreds of thousands of balls used annually by Major League Baseball?

A. Tegucigalpa, Honduras

B. Tijuana, Mexico

C. Tocumen, Panama

D. Turrialba, Costa Rica

---

3. Merck is licensing a Covid pill to a nonprofit to get it into the hands of low- and middle-income countries. What's the drug called?

A. Molnupiravir

B. Remdesivir

C. Dexamethasone

D. Adalimumab

---

4. What's an "atmospheric river?"

A. The Thames on a misty afternoon

B. The microclimate created by a crowded traffic corridor or jammed highway

C. A band of condensed water vapor that causes intense rainfall

D. The air routes used by jetliners to exploit fuel-saving winds

---

5. The Case-Shiller home price index, which tracks major metro areas, rose in the year that ended in August -- by about how much?

A. 10%

B. 20%

C. 30%

D. 40%

---

6. Home-builder Lennar and a tech startup are teaming up to build a community of 100 3-D printed houses -- near which city?

A. Portland, Ore.

B. Austin, Tex.

C. San Jose, Calif.

D. Burlington, Vt.

---

7. Ernie LaPointe was confirmed as Sitting Bull's great-grandson. What was the source of the legendary Hunkpapa Lakota Sioux leader's DNA for the test?

A. A tooth

B. A nail clipping

C. A lock of hair

D. A bloodstain

---

8. Tungsten cubes have caught on as a collectible thanks to their great density. What's equivalent to the weight of a 4-inch cube?

A. A standard red brick

B. A low-horsepower outboard motor

C. An average American

D. A Subaru Outback

---

ANSWERS

1. A

2. D

3. A

4. C

5. B

6. B

7. C

8. B
